urls.title: How EA enforcement has fallen during the pandemic
urls.description: There was a 63% drop in the number of reported environmental incidents attended by Environment Agency officers during the Covid-19 pandemic, prompting fears that polluters may escape penalties for their actions

urls.title: Thailand Interceptor Project kicks Off with Signing of MOU | The Ocean Cleanup
urls.description: Today, in collaboration with the Department of Marine and Coastal Resources (DMCR), part of the Ministry of Natural Resources and the Environment, The Ocean Cleanup signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) to establish Interceptor deployment plans in Thailand. This commitment is another necessary step on our mission to rid the world‚Äôs oceans of plastic and tackle the most polluting rivers.

tweets.text:
I‚Äôm excited to see that the Interceptor by @TheOceanCleanup will be coming to #Bangkok to remove plastic from the Chao Phraya River before it reaches the sea.

‚ô¶Ô∏èThailand Interceptor Project kicks Off with Signing of MOU https://t.co/uyOBSMVmLB #Thailand #beatplasticpollution https://t.co/K05LMsRSyl

@picturespete @NorthHertsDC @AquiferChalk @IvelRev @EnvAgency Hi Peter. Thanks for letting me know about that I will let our technicians know and we will be  out asap to get that sorted. Thanks again, Kate
